programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle discover the lengths the keepers will go for the animal orphans, and the stakes are high as vital testing for a killer disease continues.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin explore properties about to be sold in Brompton in Kent, Wolverhampton and Newcastle-under-Lyme.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence and Kev seize equipment from a sports car specialist on behalf of a customer whose car was left dripping oil after a botched repair.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: People posing as bailiffs to threaten small businesses and conning home-owners with forged trade association logos. Plus, fake breathalysers that could cost drivers their licence.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams compete at Newark Antiques and Collectors Fair, Nottinghamshire. Ben Cooper and Natasha Raskin are the experts in residence helping the sides in their pursuit for profits, as they go on to sell their items at Charles Hanson's saleroom in Derby. Plus, presenter Paul Laidlaw recounts a tale illustrating how good luck proved as effective as good judgement with the acquisition of a pair of 400-year-old powder flasks.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.sub-title: I Don't Do Animals - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The sweat lodge experience has an unexpected effect on Al, while Emma and Zara go out of their way to avoid attending the conference. Ian Midlane stars.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Long-time friends Jonathan, Ben and Ricky return to try to work out the three-digit code to crack open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright asks the questions in the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple who want to relocate to Cornwall and have a budget of £460,000, and gets a birds-eye view of Britain's largest rainforest at the Eden Project.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is joined by Norman Wilkinson and Daniel Heath, who between them revamp a guest bed, a tired armchair and an artist's easel - turning the latter into a vanity unit.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Will Axon and Mark Stacey visit the Oxford Union to admire another selection of the public's personal treasures, including a First World War bayonet. Plus, presenter Paul Martin charts the birth of rock 'n' roll through the work of music photographer Harry Hammond.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the UK Independence Party.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle apologises to Sharon for her behaviour and reaches out to Martin, hoping that the anniversary of Mark's death will help bring them back together again. Bex is taken back when Madison says sorry for everything, and Kim and Vincent invite Kush and Denise round for dinner. Ian is put out when the Vic holds a `fish and chips' evening - so Steven comes up with a plan to fight back.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The third week of heats continue with the amateurs given just 80 minutes to devise one dish using ingredients from the MasterChef market. On offer are chicken wings, quail, pancetta, brown shrimp, salmon and haddock. After three are sent home, the others cook two courses to impress not just John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also the 2013 finalists - Saira Hamilton, Larkin Cen and champion Natalie Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin and the team journey south to the oldest islands in the Galapagos to see the impact humans have had on this pristine wilderness. Moving on to the island of Isabela, Liz descends into a vertical lava cave, then makes her final land-based stop on Santa Cruz, where she meets a man on a mission to protect the giant tortoise population. Finally, she dives into the deep blue waters to witness the birth of a new island. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bronx to Bradford: Friars on a Mission
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of five brothers from a Bradford friary. The Community of the Franciscan Friars of the Renewal originated in the Bronx in New York. In Bradford, they run regular soup kitchens for the poor and the homeless, and are also hoping to restore an old run-down church to attract new followers. All this while devoting time to prayer and worship. How challenging is it for them to help those in need while they themselves must lead such a humble life?.(n)

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professors Robert Winston and Tanya Byron follow the youngsters through their GCSE year to discover how the teenagers are being shaped by these unique times. In Scotland, Nathan shares how it feels growing up in an unconventional family - attitudes to his father's homosexuality have transformed in his lifetime. And in Essex, Taliesin reveals what impact his online gaming habit is having on friendships and his sleep.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Fern Britton's Holy Land Journey
programme.desc: The presenter travels to Jerusalem on a life-changing journey of faith, in search of the real story of Jesus' final days, from his triumphal arrival, to his brutal crucifixion.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle present, continuing the story of the two endangered cheetah cubs, Poppy and Winston, who are set to go out into their open enclosure. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy catches up with a couple who have renovated a former chapel in Goudurst in Kent while Dion checks out a terraced house in Smallthorne in Stoke-on-Trent and Martin hears plans for a basement flat in a Victorian building in Cardiff. All of the properties were sold at auction but will any of the new owners make money from their investments?.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Police crack open a counterfeit champagne case, where the fakers are making a killing, and there is a look at the fake carbon monoxide detectors that could cost lives.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning presents from Elsecar Heritage Centre in North Yorkshire, home to the world's oldest steam engine, where Kate Bliss and Jonathan Pratt help the two teams.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Valerie is convinced that she can hear things in the roof of The Mill, while Karl meets someone who explains to him what chronic fatigue syndrome is. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which radiographer Brendan from Tunbridge Wells answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple to find a property in Cambridgeshire on a budget of £625,000, and visits a fenland potato farm where she develops a brand new flavour of crisp.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chelsea gold medal-winners Dave and Harry Rich transform gardens around the country within the owners' budgets, beginning at a terraced home in York.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Walsall, including a broken desk and a formica kitchen table and three chairs.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Anita Manning and Will Axon head to Wells Cathedral in Somerset to uncover some hidden treasures to be sold at auction. Items include a pair of paintings by an amateur artist and a collection of shot and powder flasks. Plus, Paul Martin takes a journey around the historic centre of the ancient city.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon presents the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in the light-hearted quiz, with swimmer Fran Halsall, St Helens star Jon Wilkin, Olympic bronze medal-winning boxer Joshua Buatsi and Scottish footballer Kim Little joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey tells Martin that Michelle has been invited over for dinner. How will Martin react and can he stay civil for the duration of the meal? Ian and Steven launch their pop-up fish-and-chip shop, and Dot gives Amy and Ricky a lesson about the meaning of Easter. Whitney, Lauren and Abi get ready for their night out - but Lauren's mind is elsewhere.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Restaurant critic Tracey Macleod sets the brief for the third quarter-final, challenging them to cook a savoury dish that showcases rice or a dessert with almonds as the star. After preparing their dish, the candidates must stand before Tracey and presenters John Torode and Gregg Wallace and hear what they think of their offering and how well they have adhered to the brief.(n)

programme.title: Decline and Fall
programme.desc: Valiantly taking the fall for the murky deeds of his fiancee Margot, Paul Pennyfeather finds himself in deep trouble with the law. Will he be able to escape imprisonment, and will his intended wait for him if he doesn't? The concluding part of James Wood's adaptation of Evelyn Waugh's classic satire set an obscure public school in Wales and which tackles the elite and corrupt institutions of 1920s England, starring Jack Whitehall, David Suchet, Eva Longoria, Douglas Hodge, Jason Watkins and Stephen Graham. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Miranda Hart discusses her role as Miss Hannigan in Annie, Keeley Hawes talks about the new series of The Durrells, Peter Capaldi reveals the reasons behind his decision to leave Doctor Who, and Warren Beatty discusses new film Rules Don't Apply. Jennifer Hudson provides the music, performing her latest single Remember Me.(n)

programme.title: Witless
programme.desc: Leanne and Rhona wake up as they are being driven down the motorway in a caravan by a mysterious figure, and news of Ian's death reaches the formidable leader Willy Whelan.(n)

programme.title: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
programme.desc: The chauvinistic host of a top-rated American news programme in 1970s San Diego fights for his status and job security when both are threatened by the arrival of an ambitious female reporter, whose determination to become a newsreader leads to a bitter battle of the sexes. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Fred Willard and Steve Carell.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team offers advice on making money from 20th-century collectibles, with presenter Paul Martin visiting London's Design Museum and expert Anita Manning exploring the legacy of Glaswegian designer, architect and artist Charles Rennie Mackintosh.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The agents will not take no for an answer at a hotel with a debt to pay, and Lawrence and Ken visit a garage after a customer discovered the car he bought had been in a crash.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a recycling centre in Walsall, West Midlands, featuring a pair of chairs, a plant stand and printed bean sacks.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don begins a brand new project when he starts a new soft fruit garden, and also plants new potatoes and divides herbaceous plants in the jewel garden. Frances Tophill visits an extraordinary tropical garden in Barbados developed from a collapsed cave, while the programme also catches up with exponent of gardening for wildlife Chris Baines, in his own small town garden. Plus, as part of the series' 50th anniversary, Mark Lane nominates the plant he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland: Ballina to Westport.
programme.desc: On the last leg of Michael Portillo's long journey from Wexford to Westport, a fashionable Victorian seaweed bath is followed by a steamy scene in Ballina. On tenterhooks in Foxford, Michael discovers the visionary charity of an entrepreneurial nun, learns of a double tragedy at Clew Bay and begins a pilgrimage to the summit of Croagh Patrick, Ireland's holy mountain. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day Two.
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces action from the second day at the Hong Kong Velodrome, featuring the finals of the men's and women's team pursuits, and the men's scratch race and keirin.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Presenter Chris Hollins reminisces about a 1988 holiday in Oxford he took as part of a cricket tour, being driven back to the location in a classic Mini by the Strictly Come Dancing judge. He is taken to the university halls he stayed in as a 17-year-old, and Len invites some of Chris's friends from the 1980s holiday to take part in a game from back in the day called Spoof.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: DJ, actor and presenter Reggie Yates sets out to trace his ancestry. His mother and father were both born in Ghana, but he never knew his grandparents, and he is keen to know where his surname comes from, believing it might be Dutch. However, as he looks further back, his family tree springs some unexpected surprises.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough: 60 Years in the Wild
programme.desc: David Attenborough reflects on environmental changes during his film-making career, the pioneering conservationists whose footsteps he followed and the revolution in attitudes toward nature. On a tropical beach in Malaysia, David recalls how in the 1950s he dug up turtle eggs to eat and releases newly hatched turtles into the wild. Finally he asks whether changing attitudes and greater knowledge of the world will be enough to save it for future generations. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Chris Gower and David Harper head to Anglesey to help two teams pick up deals at a fair before selling them at auction. Plus, Tim Wonnacott explores Waddesdon Manor in Buckinghamshire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A barometer, rowing oars that could have a hidden past and a pinball machine that has spent the last few years being used as a kitchen worktop are restored.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry's Easter Feast
programme.desc: Mary explores the roots of her faith through the medium of food, asking how Britain eats its way through Easter, and sharing her own favourite Easter recipes, including hot cross buns, Simnel cake and roast lamb. In this first episode, she discovers the traditions followed by diverse British families and communities during Lent and Good Friday, and the food that brings them together as each prepare for their Easter celebrations.(n)

programme.title: The World According to Kids
programme.desc: New series. Children aged between six and 11 from across the UK are equipped with cameras to reveal what they really think of the world, while a number of challenges offer an intimate insight into how they think. In the opening show, children from a debating club in Bradford, a pony club in Berkshire and a drama class in Gloucester explore their feelings of love and hate. Eight-year-old Abigail discusses her parents' impending wedding, Daniel is looking forward to seeing his father - who has been posted overseas with the Army - and Edmund just loves to hate his little sister.(n)

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: The epic medieval drama based on the novels by Bernard Cornwell continues. Following the battle of Dunholm, Uhtred is serving as lord of the Wessex town of Coccham - but trouble is brewing in nearby East Anglia and Aethelwold brings him news of a prophecy that raises questions of fate and duty for the warrior - and puts him at odds with Gisela. At Winchester, preparations for the royal wedding are under way as Aethelred of Mercia arrives. Beocca confides in Uhtred and is left with an important question to ask.(n)

programme.title: MOTD: The Premier League Show
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents the magazine programme featuring news and action from the Premier League, plus interviews with the country's biggest football stars.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: The group begin to settle into rural living after their first week living in Tuscany, but a storm forces them to race against time to complete the ambitious Sangiovese grape harvest, and rescue the farm's biggest income. Meanwhile, the group members look to expand the farm's potential with a new Bed and Breakfast venture, and begin to renovate an empty out-building. However, as the first guests start to arrive, all does not go according to plan, and temperamental Tuscan plumbing puts a spanner in the works for their grand ambitions.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: The traitor strikes in the palace prison, while Henriette has a rocky reunion with her brother, Charles II of England. Elsewhere, Beatrice risks a rendezvous with Marchal. The period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of King Louis XIV continues. Supported by Inside Versailles documentary shorts. Starring George Blagden, Alexander Vlahos, Tygh Runyan, Stuart Bowman, Amira Casar and Evan Williams.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: The traitor changes tactics and goes onto strike at those closest to King Louis XIV - with deadly consequences. Meanwhile, Sophie stubbornly risks angering Marchal. The period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of King Louis XIV draws to a brutal and bloody conclusion. Supported by Inside Versailles documentary shorts, presented by Professor Kate Williams and Greg Jenner. Starring George Blagden, Alexander Vlahos, Tygh Runyan, Stuart Bowman, Evan Williams and Noemie Schmidt. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Amol Rajan sets the brief as John Torode and Gregg Wallace introduce the first quarter-final, from which the best contestants go through to Knockout Week. His challenge for the amateur cooks is to make an exceptional dish, choosing from one of two briefs he has given them. The contestants must either cook a savoury dish using Indian spices or a chocolate dessert with a playful twist. After cooking their dish, the candidates must stand before Amol, John and Gregg and hear what they think of their dish and how well they have adhered to the brief.(n)

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Cameras follow prosecutors and cops in Jacksonville, Florida, renowned for its tough approach to justice. In the first edition, detectives are called to the scene of a double homicide in a trailer park, where an uncle and niece have been found strangled in their home. In the courts, Trey Wright is being prosecuted for the murder of his cousin, while controversial state attorney Angela Corey is campaigning for re-election.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team offers advice on what to look out for in the world of Victoriana. Paul Martin visits Wellington College, Caroline Hawley explains her passion for vesta cases and there is a look at what made the Victorians such masters of invention.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence and Kev seize equipment from a sports car specialist on behalf of a customer whose car was left dripping oil after a botched repair.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is joined by Norman Wilkinson and Daniel Heath, who between them revamp a guest bed, a tired armchair and an artist's easel - turning the latter into a vanity unit.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Bidford-on-Avon.
programme.desc: The team help transform the home in Bidford-on-Avon of a woman suffering from mastocytosis, a rare genetic disorder, who has been forced to stay in the living room of her family's house under constant care since her diagnosis at the age of 18. Nick Knowles, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and hundreds of Warwickshire volunteer builders redesign the entire house to provide Chloe with independence, creating a self-contained apartment complete with bedroom, wet room and sitting room within her family home.(n)

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Pirate Fairy
programme.desc: A rebellious fairy steals the magic pixie dust that grants her people the power of flight and runs away, becoming captain of a band of pirates. Tinker Bell and her friends set off to recover the dust, but succumb to a spell that switches their magical powers. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Christina Hendricks and Tom Hiddleston.(n)

programme.title: Easter Parade
programme.desc: A dancer abandoned by his usual partner trains a chorus girl as a replacement. The new pairing is a great success but, although he strives to keep their relationship strictly professional, he begins to fall head over heels in love with her. Musical, with Fred Astaire, Judy Garland, Peter Lawford and Ann Miller. Songs include A Couple of Swells, Stepping Out with My Baby and Shaking the Blues Away.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day Three.
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces day three at the Hong Kong Velodrome, featuring the finals of the men's individual pursuit and points race, and women's omnium and individual sprint.(n)

programme.title: King of Kings
programme.desc: Biblical epic chronicling the life of Christ, from the rumours of a coming Messiah before his birth, through his rise as a spiritual leader to his eventual betrayal, crucifixion and resurrection. Narrated by Orson Welles and starring Jeffrey Hunter, Siobhan McKenna, Robert Ryan, Rip Torn, Hurd Hatfield and Harry Guardino.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Jaguars Born Free: Natural World Special.
programme.desc: When three orphaned jaguar cubs are discovered in a Brazilian forest, a family decides to take the place of their mother and train them to survive in the wild. Over two years the cats must learn to climb trees, swim, and hunt for their food and if they can be successfully released, there will be new hope for this rare species. Narrated by Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A toy boat, a vintage gramophone and a doll suffering the effects of years of love and affection are restored by the experts. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry's Easter Feast
programme.desc: Mary explores the foods that bring each different community together on Easter Sunday, as well as sharing her own family favourites, such as mouthwatering roast lamb. She also discovers how the Greek Orthodox community break the fast with Tsoureki bread, spends time in the kitchen with Archbishop of York John Sentamu and discovers Filipino and Italian Easter specialities.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Nick Bailey gets to grips with an unpromising patch of grass and gives his tips on how to achieve a luscious lawn, and Carol Klein continues her series on her gardening heroes when she visits Waterperry Gardens to find out about the legacy of Beatrix Havergal. Frances Tophill selects her Golden Jubilee plant, Flo Headlam visits a garden centre in Manchester which is run by the local community, and there is a return to Adam Frost's garden, where he gives advice on how to rid borders of bindweed.(n)

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: Premiere. In 1965, amidst an atmosphere of racial unrest, civil rights campaigner Dr Martin Luther King Jr plans a peaceful march across Alabama from Selma to Montgomery. His goal is to persuade President Lyndon B Johnson to change the law, allowing black people to register to vote. Fact-based drama, starring David Oyelowo, Tom Wilkinson and Carmen Ejogo.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: New series. The 50th season of the show gets under way with performances by Kasabian, Goldfrapp, Thundercat, Anderson .Paak & The Free Nationals, Spoon and Courtney Marie Andrews.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from August 11, with artists including David Grant, Level 42 and Depeche Mode. Presented by Tommy Vance and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: The Bridge: Fifty Years Across the Forth
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating the Forth Road Bridge, one of Scotland's great landmarks and the biggest of its kind when it opened in 1964. The film includes the recollections of those who built the bridge, the memories of former ferry workers and old home-movie footage.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift : Blazes and Brigades - The Story of the Fire Service.
programme.desc: Documentary looking back on nearly two centuries of British firefighting, exploring how major incidents and the evolution of technology from manual pumps to motorised fire engines have helped forge the modern fire service. Featuring interviews with 99-year-old Doug Lightning, the last surviving fireman who served during the Sheffield blitz, and Mary-Joy Langdon, Britain's first female firefighter. Narrated by Kirsty Young.(n)

programme.title: Bucket
programme.desc: New series. Comedy, starring Miriam Margolyes as an eccentric free spirit who, having revealed she is dying, decides to embark on a trip to tick off the items on her bucket list. Frog Stone co-stars as her more reserved daughter, who reluctantly comes along for the ride.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.(n)

programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis travels through Central Asia. In Tajikistan, he meets the last survivors of the Sogdian people, a culture that proved vital to the success of the Silk Road and traded from the China Sea to the Mediterranean. He also visits the Uzbek cities of Samarkand and Bukhara, discovering how the conqueror Timur captured large numbers of craftsmen to build them, and discovers how trade between nations led to the birth of astronomy and modern mathematics.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from August 11, with artists including David Grant, Level 42 and Depeche Mode. Presented by Tommy Vance and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Depeche Mode 101
programme.desc: DA Pennebaker's documentary following the Basildon band as they prepare for the final date of their Music for the Masses tour at the Pasadena Rose Bowl in California in 1989. The film charts how their profile increased during the late 1980s, leading to them becoming one of the most popular alternative rock acts in the world, and also follows a group of young fans travelling across the USA by bus to attend the concert.(n)

programme.title: Bucket
programme.desc: New series. Comedy, starring Miriam Margolyes as an eccentric free spirit who, having revealed she is dying, decides to embark on a trip to tick off the items on her bucket list. Frog Stone co-stars as her more reserved daughter, who reluctantly comes along for the ride.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from September 1, featuring music by Modern Romance, Madness, Genesis, Big Country, Stray Cats and UB40. Presented by John Peel and David Jensen.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Dancer 2017
programme.desc: Contest showcasing the very best of young British dance talent. The dancers contesting the contemporary category at The Lowry in Salford are Joshua Attwood, Nafisah Baba, Jacob Lang, Nora Monsecour and John-William Watson. Hosted by Anita Rani, with a judging panel of Sharon Watson, Mark Bruce and Shobana Jeyasingh.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1980.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the music show's evolution, and the dramatic changes that took place in 1980 when a new generation of British pop arrived, leading to the veteran Top of the Pops orchestra being laid off, and the studio audience doubling in size. Featuring Adam Ant, the Human League, OMD, Kevin Rowland, Sally Lindsay, Kelly Marie, Ray Dorset, Johnny Logan, the Vapors, the Piranhas, and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1980 - Big Hits
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the show in the first year of the 1980s, when the rise of a new generation of pop stars signalled a new era for Top of the Pops and for British society. Featuring My Girl by Madness, Brass in Pocket by Pretenders and Geno by Dexys Midnight Runners, as well as appearances by Adam Ant, Spandau Ballet, the Piranhas, Hot Chocolate, OMD, Motorhead and the Beat.(n)

programme.title: Music for Misfits: The Story of Indie
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates an examination of the history of the indie genre, beginning by exploring the origins of the UK's alternative music scene with the emergence of independent record labels and the eclectic sound hubs they spawned in cities across the country. It looks at the impact of Buzzcocks' Spiral Scratch EP from 1977, which was the first independently produced and distributed release of the era and inspired others to set up labels including Factory, Postcard and Rough Trade. Featuring exclusive interviews with performers including New Order's Stephen Morris and Gillian Gilbert, Buzzcocks' frontman Pete Shelley, James Dean Bradfield of Manic Street Preachers, Belle and Sebastian's Stuart Murdoch, Malcolm Ross of Aztec Camera and Orange Juice, and the Jesus and Mary Chain's Jim Reid. With contributions from Influential music industry figures such as Pete Waterman, Factory Records' designer Peter Saville, music entrepreneur Seymour Stein, and music producer and Mute Records founder Daniel Miller.(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Selena was a 23-year old Tejana singer on the verge of an international breakthrough when she was shot by the president of her own fan club. Her death spawned an outpouring of grief not seen since the death of Elvis Presley. This upbeat and tuneful biopic, executive produced by her father, Abraham Quintanilla (portrayed in the film by Edward James Olmos), is a celebration of his daughter's life, chronicling her rise to fame. The film opens with Selena (Jennifer Lopez) performing at the Houston Astrodome before a sold-out audience. The story moves backwards and begins not with Selena, but with Abraham who in the early '60s had an unsuccessful doo-wop group in Texas. As a child, Selena (Rebecca Lee Meza) showed an exceptional talent for singing. Abraham exploited that and the talents of his other two children to form a band. Much of the film focuses on the fact that Selena, though born in Texas in a Mexican-American community, had to learn Spanish as a second language. Her father insisted that she sing in the language, but it was not easy for her. To maintain the story's celebratory air, it only lightly touches on Selena's relationship with her killer -- the actual shooting occurs off-screen. The after-effects of Selena's death are also only briefly presented(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs entrusts the team with the task of finding his former commanding officer, who has gone on the run rather than staying behind to face charges of killing a marine and stealing funds. Kate and Tony's investigation leads them to the missing man's cabin - which has been sprayed with bullets and contains an unidentified corpse. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky, Gerald and Kate are taken hostage by a gunman who demands evidence relating to the recent shooting of a suspected terrorist. As Gibbs and the team struggle to resolve the crisis, they are alarmed to discover there is a Hamas operative in their midst. Crime drama, guest starring Alan Dale (Ugly Betty).(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Sloan links a suspicious suicide to a dating agency, prompting Jack to go undercover to investigate - but he must take the deception further than anticipated to crack the case. Mystery drama, starring Dick Van Dyke and Scott Baio.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.sub-title: Gold Train: The Bullet - Part Three.
programme.desc: Part three of three. The leader of the bandits who have taken over the train discovers that Matt is on board - and has a score to settle with the lawman.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss is close to death and can only be saved by the man who shot him after an ex-Confederate soldier demands $50,000 from Ben.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and his team investigate the gruesome case of four family members found murdered in their home and initially suspect the mother is responsible - but subsequent evidence points to an entirely different conclusion. Crime drama, starring David Caruso and Kim Delaney.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After a mid-series break, the drama following the exploits of the Los Angeles-based Office of Special Projects returns. Sam and Callen investigate when five men wearing US Marine uniforms are found dead in a warehouse and discover they were killed by a lethal toxin that could be used as a bioweapon. Initial inquiries lead them to a former military chemist who now has Alzheimer's, while Callen recognises one of the victims as someone who used to work as hired muscle for the well-connected owner of a strip joint. Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: The team are sent to the country of Valeria to make sure the corrupt Nationalist Party don't win an election using rigged voting machines. Espionage drama, starring Steven Hill.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Part three of three. Bud's leg is blown off in an explosion as he tries to rescue a girl from a minefield, and he finds himself fighting for his life. Harm and Mac disobey orders so they can visit him in hospital, while Admiral Chegwiddwen and Lt Singer testify before the Senate Intelligence Committee about their roles in the search for Kabir Atef.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is taken aback to discover Tony's father is linked to the team's latest investigation, a politically sensitive case involving an assassination attempt on Prince Sayif, a visiting Saudi dignitary with a taste for the high life. Guest starring Robert Wagner, with Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: The murder of a volleyball player reveals how much her team-mates disliked her, and a mysterious stalker only serves to complicate matters further for the sleuthing medic. Drama, starring Dick Van Dyke, Victoria Rowell and Barry Van Dyke.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A wrecked plane leads the lawman to investigate a robbery and murder that took place eight years earlier.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when an Islamic terrorist group in Iraq steals a truck with $5million and track the money back to America. The agents learn the cash has been used to set up a bank robbery intended as a ruse to allow a bank employee to transfer $100million of the terrorists' money that has been frozen by the government in an offshore bank. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A sniper begins targeting victims at random, killing each with a single shot to the head. Horatio and the team investigate - but their progress is hampered by TV news reporters eager to turn the murders into a national story. Drama, starring David Caruso, Kim Delaney and Khandi Alexander.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Dan launches a personal crusade to rescue a friend's daughter who has been kidnapped by a mobster and used as blackmail against the team. Action adventure, starring Steven Hill.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs entrusts the team with the task of finding his former commanding officer, who has gone on the run rather than staying behind to face charges of killing a marine and stealing funds. Kate and Tony's investigation leads them to the missing man's cabin - which has been sprayed with bullets and contains an unidentified corpse. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.desc: Ducky, Gerald and Kate are taken hostage by a gunman who demands evidence relating to the recent shooting of a suspected terrorist. As Gibbs and the team struggle to resolve the crisis, they are alarmed to discover there is a Hamas operative in their midst. Crime drama, guest starring Alan Dale (Ugly Betty).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is taken aback to discover Tony's father is linked to the team's latest investigation, a politically sensitive case involving an assassination attempt on Prince Sayif, a visiting Saudi dignitary with a taste for the high life. Guest starring Robert Wagner, with Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss is close to death and can only be saved by the man who shot him after an ex-Confederate soldier demands $50,000 from Ben.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Alex, CD and a group of children are taken hostage, and find themselves in the path of a dangerous cyclone.(n)

programme.title: The Streets of San Francisco
programme.desc: The daughter of a fashion designer confesses to murdering her mother's boyfriend, but Stone discovers she was only an innocent bystander at the killing, and is in danger from the real murderer's wish to eliminate a witness.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy bargains galore.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While performing an autopsy for a class of military students, Ducky discovers the cadaver he is using is the body of a murder victim. In trying to identify the corpse, Gibbs and his team are set on the trail of a career criminal specialising in identity fraud. Meanwhile, Ziva has difficulty separating her personal feelings and professional judgment. Starring David McCallum and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. The ship proves to have been abandoned by its crew, and Ducky discovers the victim died from a highly contagious virus - putting everyone presently on board at risk. Drama, starring David McCallum, Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Lauren Holly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A taxi driver and an admiral working at the Pentagon are found executed by the side of a road, but the agents have trouble ascertaining a motive - until they uncover links to a woman searching for her missing husband, a political refugee from Africa. Meanwhile, McGee makes a discovery about his new girlfriend. Starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby babysits a bright nine-year-old while the other members of the team try to locate the youngster's missing father - a survivalist wanted in connection with a case of robbery and murder. The search takes them deep into the wilderness - where a startling discovery awaits. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A traumatised marine escapes from a psychiatric unit, convinced he is still fighting in Iraq. The agents believe his erratic behaviour indicates post-traumatic stress disorder and try to calmly talk him round before restraining him. However, blood tests reveal high levels of steroids in his system - meaning someone is using him as a human lab rat. Starring Lauren Holly, Sean Murray and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team set up a stake-out at a storage facility to catch a thief suspected of selling hi-tech Navy equipment on the black market, but end up witnessing a murder. To make matters worse, $90million worth of radar gear goes missing while they are distracted. Meanwhile, Ducky asks Abby to run a series of mysterious blood tests, raising suspicions that he is harbouring a secret.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A suspect in a drug-smuggling case is seemingly mauled to death by his own dog, which is immediately scheduled to be destroyed - but Abby refuses to hand it over to Navy officials and launches her own investigation. Meanwhile, Gibbs continues to worry about Shepard's health, convinced she and Ducky are hiding something. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Mark Harmon and Lauren Holly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Marine is seemingly killed in a mortar attack on America's heavily fortified administrative HQ in Baghdad, but a subsequent autopsy reveals he was murdered. Intelligence analyst Nikki Jardine volunteers to help Tony investigate the case - but her behaviour in Iraq makes him suspect she had an ulterior motive for requesting the assignment.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Assistant coroner Palmer is called to the building site on a Navy base where a body has been found. While looking into the incident, he spots an armed man fleeing the scene with the victim's passport and is almost killed as he gives chase. It appears the document was stolen to hinder the investigation, but the discovery of a second corpse reveals a case of stolen identity and a compensation racket.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part story, the entire team is put in danger while hunting for the killer of a former NCIS agent. Jenny Shepard calls in Mike Franks for help, afraid she too is a target - and convinced Gibbs will be next. American crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Vance sticks rigidly to the rules as he investigates the death of a fellow agent, but Gibbs and Franks take matters into their own hands to catch the killers. The case also leads to major changes for the agency. Drama, starring Rocky Carroll, Mark Harmon and Muse Watson.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Calvin Lee, an executive naval officer, appears to commit suicide by hanging himself from a public road bridge. When examining CCTV footage of the incident, Sam and Callen discover the dead man tossed away a small object before jumping to his death, and when they learn the late lieutenant commander had been working on a sensitive project involving new cloaking technology for submarines, they immediately take an interest in the item. The investigation draws the team into the furtive world of LA's Chinese community, where they discover Lee might have been harbouring some personal as well as professional secrets. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio, Speedle and Calleigh investigate the murder of an unconventional college professor whose body has been found tied to a tree, while Megan and Delko are alerted to an insurance fraud by the discovery of a car with a grisly secret in its boot. American police drama, starring David Caruso, Kim Delaney and Khandi Alexander.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs discovers a link between the murder of a petty officer and the break-up of his team, leading him and new director Leon Vance to uncover a case of blackmail involving an NCIS agent. The duo single out three suspects, but learn vital information has been stolen, and realise the whole Persian Gulf Fleet could be in danger.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 304. A towel designed for modesty when changing into and out of a bathing suit; a sweater-quilt combination; a way to keep wine fresh, a cake mix for dogs. Also: an update on a class-notes sharing site for college students. Guest shark: inventor Lori Greiner(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 518. A maker of stylish baby shoes impresses Mark Cuban with her story; a Utah man pitches his pill substitute for food; two sisters try to attract interest in their sun-safe swimwear line for children; and a San Diego entrepreneur claims that his custom playing cards make exercise convenient and fun. Also: an udate on Daisy Cakes, which Barbara invested in during Season 2(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 628. A 14-year-old entrepreneur pitches a product for pet owners who want to "visit" their animals while away; a T-shirt that displays hometown pride has celebrity fans and more than $1 million in sales; and Barbara Corcoran invites her most successful partners on a ski getaway in Deer Valley, Utah. Also: software for managing an online reputation(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 726. A heated exchange takes place in the Season 7 finale when a Shark's temper is lost after an entrepreneur refuses an offer "for personal reasons." Other highlights include a line of healthy treats made just for women; a rare second chance to strike a deal; and updates on some viewer favorites(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 627. A Pittsburgh man hopes to green up the landscaping and gardening industries with his sustainable soil replacement for peat moss; two Colorado moms try to make a deal for their sweet-flavored face wipes; business partners present what they believe is a safer way to connect electrical wires; and there's a pitch for a digital text technology that could change the way eBooks are read(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 509. A record is broken by one lucky entrepreneur, who accepts an unprecedented amount for a deal, while a producer of Halloween attractions takes some heat for overvaluing her business. Also: a repair wrap from two men in Utah; a product designed to help communicate feelings; and an update on fishing bobbers made from shotgun shells, which Mark invested in during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 511. An Austin couple shock the Sharks with the profits they are making from knee-high boot socks; publicists from Santa Monica, Cal., have come up with a stylish clutch that's perfect for carrying smartphones; and a finance expert pitches his idea for customized chocolate bars. Also: a way for kids to personalize their lunch boxes; and an update on a device that prevents objects from falling out of reach between a car's seat and the center console(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug discovers Carrie used to have a crush on his dentist - who he is convinced is deliberately making his root canal operation as painful as possible. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie and Doug book an appointment for Arthur to see a psychotherapist but soon find they are the ones needing treatment as they try to sort their problems out. Comedy, guest starring William Hurt and Ben Stiller.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy's brother Peter turns to Ray for advice on talking to women, while Debra decides to help out by throwing a party and inviting all her single friends.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra nags Raymond to tidy up after himself, but he is more concerned with a letter he has received from his sporting hero - which accidentally ends up in the bin.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: An offhand comment to the twins' new friend has dire consequences for Ray, who cannot understand why everyone is so upset - but he compounds his error by accidentally repeating the remark to the boy's father. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes an election broadcast on behalf of Seattle mayoral hopeful Holden Thorpe, prompting Frasier and Niles to throw their weight behind a rival candidate - who proves highly unsuitable for public office. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, with the guest voice of Sydney Pollack.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part one of two. While visiting the island of Bora Bora with new girlfriend Madeline, Frasier is unexpectedly reunited with his ex-wife Lilith. Comedy, guest starring JoBeth Williams and Bebe Neuwirth.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to reverse the fortunes of a diner in Bellmore, New York, where a talented cook's work is being undone by the manager's marketing plans - putting the finances in dire straits.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller visits a wildlife sanctuary in Dorset, where he examines a tawny owl that has an eye injury after being hit by a vehicle, and bottle-feeds two orphaned fawns.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James and Jo are taken by surprise when a bumper-car collector looking for a loan turns up at the shop offering an impromptu test drive. Patrick is star-struck when he deals with a bass guitarist known for playing with Eric Clapton, Jamo works hard to authenticate a catalogue thought to be signed by astronaut Neil Armstrong, and a young woman in financial difficulty is desperate to borrow against some paintings so she can make a fresh start.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer presents the words-and-numbers game, with Rachel Riley dealing the words and numbers, while Susie Dent is joined by restaurant critic Jay Rayner in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton help Ginny Lunn search for a holiday home in Dorset or on the Costa Tropical in Spain, with each property expert showing her three options.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples compete for the cash prize in Yorkshire, serving up a Mexican feast, an Indian-inspired meal and, to round off the week, some no-nonsense `proper grub'.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge is delighted to get behind the wheel of a rugged all-terrain vehicle, but her new-found sense of power quickly turns into road rage, something Chief Wiggum is very keen to stamp out.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna worries about her babies when she starts getting pains, and Scott finds out more than he bargained for about his biological mother. Elsewhere, Ellie swears to do Nathan proud, and Freddie gets a shock.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present the nominees for buildings constructed in the 20th century. Anna takes in Castle Drogo - the last castle built in Britain, Jonathan Foyle loses himself in the art deco glamour of the former Birmingham Central Fire Station, and Marianne Suhr uncovers how a much-loved building in Newcastle has been rescued from the brink. Kevin and Anna then hear which building the judges have put through to the shortlist before the overall winner is revealed. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The final documentary about the Mormon community meets Chris and Sasha, who have recently moved to Rockland Ranch. Chris's late father was the founder of the community, and he dreams of one day building his own '`family kingdom' with four wives and 50 children, But as the couple decide to approach a potential second wife, unforeseen challenges lie ahead. The Utah State Senate is attempting to make polygamy illegal, forcing the community to rise up and fight for their way of life. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Super Orgasm
programme.desc: For most women multiple orgasms can seem almost mythical. But some can experience it not once, twice or even 10 times, but 60, 70 or 100 - a super-orgasm. In this documentary, a group of these women volunteer for a series of tests in a scientific investigation to reveal the truth behind the super-orgasm. The aim is to measure and record the phenomenon for the first time, finding out how the brain and the body react before, during and after, and asking if these women are wired differently to other people. And if not, is it something that could be learned by anyone?.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Billy is rushed to St George's after being crushed by falling bricks that were being stored on his front drive, while six-year-old Luther has a metal washer stuck on his finger. Senior healthcare play specialist Tracy talks about her job, which is to comfort and distract children during their treatment in A&E, and 83-year-old Audrey arrives with her grandson Lee after damaging her wrist while falling on holiday.(n)

programme.title: My Online Nightmare
programme.desc: This documentary explores some of the most extraordinary scammers and fraudsters who use the internet to lure and con their victims with terrifying, and sometimes deadly, results. This first episode examines astonishing cases of sex fraud, telling the stories of people who were tricked into thinking that the person they met online were someone completely different.(n)

programme.title: Tuning 2 You: Lost Musicians of India
programme.desc: New series. Two London brothers - one and musician, the other a photojournalist - visit six Indian states to explore the country's folk music, beginning in West Bengal.(n)

programme.title: Tuning 2 You: Lost Musicians of India
programme.desc: The brothers reach India's largest state, Rajasthan, where Soumik is invited to play inside the spectacular Ajmer Sharif shrine, crashes a wedding and jams with tribal drummers.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the behaviour of the animals at Chester Zoo. Kendari the babirusa - a bizarre-looking creature also known as a deer-pig - is trying to give birth, but is being disturbed by a couple of mischievous otters. Young male orang-utan Willie struggles to impress the females, while Raz the aye-aye, a rare nocturnal primate related to lemurs, is being encouraged to share his home with two jumping rats.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton meets Juana and Trevor Jones, who plan to knock down some 300-year-old decrepit barns, and build themselves a stylish retirement home in the Lincolnshire countryside. While sceptical about their ability to do this on a £100,000 budget, Charlie soon realises goung over-budget may be the least of the couple's problems. Ex-builder Trevor is determined to be hands-on with the project, and even refuses to down tools when he is facing a life-saving operation.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert discovers a clutter problem in Ben and Kate's Grade II-listed cottage in Shoreham-by-Sea, West Sussex, which is still languishing on the market despite 15 viewings by potential buyers. In nearby Worthing, he presents busy single mother Zoe with a long list of changes required before her home can compete on the housing market.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits the Devon County Show, where she discovers the secret of home-made handscrub and learns about beekeeping and making beeswax candles. She also tries her hand at crafting jewellery in silver clay - an ideal way of making unusual but inexpensive gifts.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer presents the words-and-numbers game, with Rachel Riley dealing the words and numbers, while Susie Dent is joined by restaurant critic Jay Rayner in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank puts salt on Marie's home-made lasagne, causing her to think she is turning into a terrible cook, but Ray and Robert discover their father has lost his sense of taste - apparently because of a potency medication he is taking. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle, Doris Roberts, Ray Romano and Brad Garrett.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy chats non-stop through a basketball game, and Ray responds by suggesting to Robert that she talks too much - a criticism she does not take well. Comedy, starring Monica Horan and Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets fired from the movie, prompting her to take a serious look at her life. Raj receives advice from Sheldon after he sees Emily on a date with another man at the cinema, while Howard's mother breaks her leg. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the seventh series finale, Sheldon becomes upset about his career, the destruction of the comic-book store and Leonard and Penny's future living arrangements. Elsewhere, Howard is unable to keep hold of a carer for his mother. Comedy, staring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer develops a knack for cooking and challenges Marge to a baking contest. Determined to win at any cost, she resorts to cheating in a bid to avoid humiliation. Meanwhile, Bart holds a `Playdude' party attended by Hollywood veteran James Caan.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa is teased mercilessly by her classmates for having a weight problem. Marge learns school bully Nelson Muntz has never had a paternal role model and invites him to live with the family - much to Bart's dismay.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: She Used to Be My Girl.
programme.desc: Marge is left feeling jealous and dejected by an encounter with old school friend Chloe (guest star Kim Cattrall), who has found fame, fortune and success as a high-flying investigative journalist.(n)

programme.title: The Phantom
programme.desc: A jungle-dwelling masked adventurer leaves his African home for New York in a bid to stop the power-crazed schemes of an evil industrialist. The tycoon is on the hunt for three legendary magical skulls, which can be combined to form the ultimate weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Billy Zane, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Treat Williams and Patrick McGoohan.(n)

programme.sub-title: Marge and Homer Turn a Couple Play.
programme.desc: Homer and Marge dispense marital advice to a player on the Isotopes baseball team whose career is flagging due to his sexy wife singing at each game. The Simpsons soon find their own marriage on the rocks, and struggle to save their relationship while helping the couple. With the voice of Mandy Moore.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa has to share a room with Bart and finds it difficult to cope with the stress, so Homer comes up with a solution. Meanwhile, Marge becomes addicted to eavesdropping on other people's conversations.(n)

programme.desc: Mercedes is put in an awkward position when Freddie turns up with Lexi and asks her to take her. Meanwhile, Neeta and Sally plan to move, but Neeta has some skeletons in her closet, and Marnie steps up her revenge plan.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Krishnan Guru-Murthy and director Karim Shah travel to Myanmar to investigate why its fledgling democracy under Aung San Suu Kyi is already under attack. It is a year since decades of military dictatorship came to an end in the country and Aung San Suu Kyi began leading a new era of civilian government, but the woman hailed around the world is now being criticised for failing to bring real freedoms to many, and the fighting against various rebel groups has intensified.(n)

programme.title: The Wild Weekenders

The trio offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK?.(n)

Elsewhere, the doctor's treat a man struggling to cope with Crohn's disease which makes him throw up every time he attempts to swallow his pills, and Dr Muki Sri treats a worried patient who has discovered a lump under his tongue.(n)

programme.desc: Officers come under attack from a gang of violent armed robbers, while Jon and Chris have their work cut out catching up with a dangerous speeder. Plus, the `Big Blue Van' respond to reports of bottles raining down on the streets and a routine stop on a delivery driver leads one of the interceptors to discover more than he bargained for.(n)

programme.desc: Zac cannot bring himself to confess to Leah and also manages to alienate Sam, while Evelyn has a decision to make after Matt finds the letter offering her a post in Vietnam.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amy and Leo try to work things out after hitting a bump in their relationship, while Brooke is determined to make amends with the neighbours she scammed.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An internal security breach forces NCIS to go into lockdown when a covert listening device is found in a pen belonging to Secretary of the Navy Sarah Porter. DiNozzo discovers that National Security Agency analyst Ellie Bishop wrote a report two years previously predicting the possibility of such an occurrence and she is brought in to assist with the investigation and track down the culprit. Guest starring Leslie Hope and Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: Independence Daysaster
programme.desc: America's fourth of July celebrations are abruptly interrupted when Earth is invaded by hostile aliens. A maverick scientist and a small-town firefighter join forces to find and activate the only piece of technology in the world that can destroy the extraterrestrial army. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Merriman and Tom Everett Scott.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amy and Leo try to work things out after hitting a bump in their relationship, while Brooke is determined to make amends with the neighbours she scammed.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Zac cannot bring himself to confess to Leah and also manages to alienate Sam, while Evelyn has a decision to make after Matt finds the letter offering her a post in Vietnam.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Claire and Simon seek eviction specialist Chris's help to evict a man claiming to be renting their old family home. Meanwhile, Hamza hopes to get his council flat back after he tried to help a neighbour's friend by letting them stay for a week, but ended up being shut out when they refused to leave. Plus, a man is almost £30k in debt and in danger of repossession after his tenants stopped paying the rent.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Depressed, Stressed and Repossessed.
programme.desc: Stories of people struggling on benefits. Mark from Cheltenham is a part-time drag queen who lost his Spanish bar after a licensing dispute. Now home and claiming sickness benefits for depression, he is keen to get well enough to work again. Plus, the stories of a widowed grandmother whose life has been tough since her drug-addicted grandson was sent to prison for attacking her, and a 63-year-old joiner who cannot work because of back trouble.(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Two more families swap places for a week, getting a taste of each other's lives in rural Essex and inner-city London. The Heasemans live in a luxurious farmhouse with six acres of land. The Webbs rent a maisonette in a tower block that is so small, eldest son Marcus is confined to the sofa in the living room. How will both families find their new living arrangements - and the accompanying budgets?.(n)

programme.title: Fritzl: What Happened Next
programme.desc: The case of the Austrian man who kept his daughter prisoner for 24 years in the cellar of his house, until she was released in 2008 at the age of 42. Dramatically pleading guilty to all of the charges at the last moment of the trial, he was sentenced to life in a secure unit for incest, imprisonment, raping the victim - who bore seven children - and causing the death of one child by neglect. This documentary explores the crime itself, Fritzl's trial and the aftermath for everyone involved, and ponders how anyone can possibly recover from such an ordeal.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.sub-title: When Kids Kill: Bullied to Death: Bullied to Death.
programme.desc: Series retelling the stories of some of Britain's most high-profile child killers. The first edition investigates the case of teenagers Hatice Can and Oluwakemi Ajose, who were convicted of the manslaughter of Rosimeiri Boxall in 2009. Presented by Leah Green.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: Part one of two. Megan returns to work following Peter's death, and though initially assigned to a seemingly routine case soon finds herself investigating the mysterious deaths of five veterans of the conflict in Afghanistan after she uncovers their bodies close by to the scene of her inquiry. Following an examination of the victims she comes to the conclusion that the killer must have had medical training. But is army medic Dr Harvey Wallace the correct suspect? When further veterans suffer from the same fate as their colleagues the former neurosurgeon begins to think otherwise. Mark Valley (Boston Legal) joins the cast as new homicide detective Tommy Sullivan.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Nick Wallis shows how CCTV and technological advances are helping tackle the problem of violent crime, from burglaries to muggings and street fights. In west London, camera operators assist police as they try to enforce a drinking ban on a newly renovated park in Hammersmith, and later give guidance to officers after they spot a youth armed with a knife prowling the streets in the early hours.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice suggests improvements for a four-bedroom dormer bungalow in Clapham, West Sussex, to make it more appealing to prospective buyers. The lurid wall colours and pink living room carpet are banished, leaving pine floorboards that help create a sense of the outdoors.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow profiles scientist, engineer, inventor and painter Leonardo da Vinci, whose extraordinary artistic genius gave rise to masterpieces including the Mona Lisa, the Annunciation and the Last Supper. Breaking new ground in portraiture and historical imagery, this giant of the Italian Renaissance used his wide-ranging skills to make a unique contribution to the development of European art.(n)

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Naturalist Nick Baker searches for the world's most dangerous animals. He begins with a trip to the remote Llanos region of Venezuela in the hope of encountering the anaconda, one of nature's largest snakes.(n)

programme.title: Pip Ahoy
programme.desc: The friends enter a fancy-dress competition at Salty Cove, but Pip realises he has lost the telescope he uses to watch the goings-on at sea.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Lily puts her newly discovered set of measuring spoons to good use when Nonna takes a tumble and needs a rest, leaving Salty to step in and cook an important pudding.(n)

programme.sub-title: I Want to Be a Pirate.
programme.desc: The youngster decides to be a pirate, but is unhappy when she is told to do her chores.(n)

programme.desc: When Leo has to make a film for college, Scoop tries so hard to get on camera that he does not think about the mess he is creating along the way.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Jupiter comes to the rescue when Sarah and James accidentally cause a fire in the water tower.(n)

programme.desc: The engines hear spooky noises when a delivery of pipes is being unloaded at Brendam Docks, and Salty points out that it is the sound of the `flatbeds of fear'. Only Emily insists that there must be a sensible explanation - until she hears the sound herself.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The puppet takes a trip to the seaside, where he builds sandcastles.(n)

programme.desc: The sleuth investigates when there are signs that a dragon has come to live in Fable Forest for the first time.(n)

programme.desc: The elves give the King chickens so he can have eggs whenever he likes.(n)

programme.desc: When Mungo accidently starts up Scottie with Archie on board, Digby realises that he has the chance to be a hero. However, saving Scottie and Archie is far harder than he imagined.(n)

programme.desc: George and Peppa play with their cousin Chloe, but the older children are unimpressed by the games on offer.(n)
