programme.desc: Madame Gazelle takes the children to Grampy Rabbit's gym class, where they learn how to be explorers.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Bert and Barry the polar bears come to Wissper with a penguin problem - there are so many penguins on the ice that they cannot enjoy a sedate skate.(n)

programme.title: Toot the Tiny Tugboat
programme.desc: The harbour's 100th anniversary arrives, and everyone plans to celebrate with a big party, but Toot becomes upset when he manages to lose all the balloons.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and the panel debate the day's issues before opening the discussion to the studio audience and inviting viewers to call in or text their opinions.(n)

programme.title: Funniest Fails, Falls & Flops
programme.desc: Comedy clip show featuring pranks gone wrong, unwise acts and failed attempts of misplaced ambition.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Tori admits she is contemplating moving to the city with Riley, while Mason asks Olivia to go on a road trip and Alf is delighted that Irene seems to be bonding with her grandchild.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David enjoys getting to know his new father and takes a big step forward with his life. Amy distracts herself from her relationship woes with Leo by helping Jack out at the church.(n)

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David enjoys getting to know his new father and takes a big step forward with his life. Amy distracts herself from her relationship woes with Leo by helping Jack out at the church.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Tori admits she is contemplating moving to the city with Riley, while Mason asks Olivia to go on a road trip and Alf is delighted that Irene seems to be bonding with her grandchild.(n)

programme.title: Last Days of Jesus
programme.desc: Documentary re-examining the crucifixion, revealing the events that may have sparked Jesus' religious movement including the death of John the Baptist and an increasing resentment among the people towards the religious authorities' opulent lifestyles and obedience to Rome. The programme also examines how power was shifting in the highest reaches of the Roman Empire, while archaeologists reveal new findings concerning Jesus' execution.(n)

programme.title: Tony Robinson: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: The presenter reaches the North Yorkshire Moors and takes to the skies for a bird's-eye view of the journey ahead from the cockpit of a glider from the Sutton Bank gliding club. Back on the ground, he admires the ruins of Rievaulx Abbey and learns the tale of power and greed that eventually brought down the monastery. In the orchards of Ampleforth Abbey, where rare heritage varieties are grown to produce juice and cider, Tony discovers a secret that evokes vivid memories of his childhood.(n)

programme.title: Spectacular Spain with Alex Polizzi
programme.desc: Alex arrives in the popular holiday region of Andalucia and begins her exploration at the Tabernas desert in Almeria, a striking and unusual part of Spain has featured in countless spaghetti westerns. She then moves further west to the green and fertile mountains of La Alpujarra in the foothills of the Sierra Nevada mountain range, a region famous for its tranquil retreats and alleged healing waters.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Cruise Ship
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary following engineers and designers as they construct the liner Seven Seas Explorer. The aim of cruise boss Frank Del Rio is to make it the most luxurious ship of its type, designed to convey 750 passengers when others of its size would hold 5,000. Building the £360million vessel is a race against time for Italian shipbuilders Fincantieri, as tickets for the maiden voyage go on sale long before it is finished. The most expensive suite boasts a grand piano, a butler and its own spa, and costs £8,000 per night, while the owner is spending £5million on art works to furnish the rooms.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: The Championship
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce highlights from the latest games, including Huddersfield Town v Preston North End, and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Brighton & Hove Albion.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: Goal Rush
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce all the goals from the weekend's games in Leagues One and Two, including Port Vale v Sheffield United and Portsmouth v Plymouth Argyle.(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: A failed actor takes a job as a high-school drama teacher in Tucson, where he tries to make a comeback by staging an outrageous musical sequel to Shakespeare's play. Steve Coogan stars in this uproarious satire. Directed by Andrew Fleming(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: Following up on her acclaimed debut, Clockwatchers, Jill Sprecher spins this intricate ensemble film about life's big questions. Set in New York City, the film focuses on five different characters with radically different perspectives on life. Gene (Alan Arkin) manages a large insurance company and is a compulsive pessimist, constantly bursting the bubbles of his more cheery colleagues. Walker (John Turturro), who holds a similarly bleak view of the world, decides that he cannot stand another day in his dull life as a physics professor and thus promptly dumps his wife, Patricia (Amy Irving). Troy (Matthew McConaughey) is an up-and-coming lawyer whose career is derailed after a hit-and-run accident. And Beatrice (Clea DuVall) is a modest cleaning woman hoping for a miracle. This film was screened at the 2001 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: The third entry in the Dirty Harry series sees Clint Eastwood saddled with a female assistant (Tyne Daly, later to go on to fame in Cagney and Lacey ) as the pair search for the kidnapped mayor of San Francisco, who's being held hostage by a terrorist group. Tracking them down to a deserted Alcatraz, it's time for Harry to get the trusty Magnum out again in James Fargo's all- action movie(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Espionage comedy starring Eddie Murphy and Owen Wilson. An inexperienced CIA agent (Wilson) is assigned to track down the arms dealers who stole a high-tech US fighter plane that has the technology to become invisible. The only problem is he has to team up with a cocky, and often idiotic, professional boxer, of whom the arms dealers are known to be fans. Also stars Famke Janssen and Malcolm McDowell(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss, Dan Hedaya and Seymour Cassel star in this comedy about mobsters who come out of retirement for one last job. Facing eviction from the hotel where they live, the guys try to scare off the owners with a staged shooting. But the plan backfires, and a hilarious comedy of errors begins. Carrie-Anne Moss, Jennifer Tilly(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: This action drama puts a new spin on Shaft, one of the key "blaxploitation" films of the 1970s. John Shaft (Samuel L. Jackson), the namesake nephew of the legendary private eye (Richard Roundtree), is a street-smart police detective who with his partner Carmen Velez (Vanessa L. Williams) has been assigned to a racially motivated murder case, in which a black college student was killed in front of a restaurant by Walter Williams Jr. (Christian Bale), the sociopathic son of a New York construction tycoon, who then fled the country rather than face prosecution. Diane Palmieri (Toni Collette), a waitress on a smoke break, saw the murder, but she doesn't want to talk to the police. Two years later, Walter is forced to return to New York, but without Diane's testimony, the city doesn't have much of a case. Soon, Shaft, Walter Junior, and Walter Senior's goons are all looking for Diane, with Junior enlisting the help of Peoples Hernandez (Jeffrey Wright), a small-time drug dealer who will do anything to move into the big leagues. Shaft and Carmen find Diane, but discover that she had a good reason for being on the lam for the past two years. Amidst all this activity, John gets frequent advice from his uncle, with whom he ponders the idea of quitting the force and opening a detective agency. Shaft was directed by John Singleton, from a screenplay by Singleton, Richard Price, and Shane Salerno(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Kicked out of a successful metal group 20 years previously, Robert 'Fish' Fishman gets a second chance at fame when he joins his nephew's band. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas and the other Gladers journey across a brutal, obstacle-filled wasteland called the Scorch. Along the way, they search for information regarding the mysterious organisation known as WCKD(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: A cop in a hi-tech "pre-crime" unit in 2054 goes on the run after being labelled as a future killer. In order to prove his innocence, he kidnaps one of the psychics who predicts the imminent crimes while eluding a determined government agent(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: In a grim near future, weighed down by economic chaos and high unemployment, criminals on death row race armoured cars for the entertainment of the public. The death rate is high, but the winner can earn his freedom. One such con is persuaded to race in the masked guise of a popular champion, but he begins to worry that an anonymous driver is unlikely to win this gladiatorial game(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: A young woman (Teresa Palmer) must protect her brother (Gabriel Bateman) from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother (Maria Bello), who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana. Billy Burke and Alexander DiPersia co-star. Produced by James Wan (The Conjuring), Lights Out is a feature-length expansion of director David F. Sandberg's short film of the same name, which became a viral sensation online(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge"(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: A hit man is forced to commit three difficult killings in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Adventurer Rick O'Connell fights to prevent a resurrected Chinese emperor taking over the world. Action sequel(n)

programme.title: The Clearing
programme.desc: Robert Redford and Helen Mirren shine in this suspenseful thriller about a wealthy couple torn apart when the husband is kidnapped by a disgruntled former employee (Willem Dafoe). The millionaire's abduction sets off a nationwide FBI manhunt. Alessandro Nivola, Matt Craven, Melissa Sagemiller, Wendy Crewson(n)

programme.title: How High
programme.desc: Pothead Silas finds he's invented an amazing strain of weed when he mixes the ashes of his late pal with the rest of his dope. The resulting combination gives him an intellectual boost and takes him and buddy Jamal to Harvard. They're the coolest kids on campus, until their supply runs out..(n)

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc: The true story of prominent mathematician John Forbes Nash Jr. is the subject of this biographical drama from director Ron Howard. Russell Crowe stars as the brilliant but arrogant and conceited professor Nash. The prof seems guaranteed a rosy future in the early '50s after he marries beautiful student Alicia (Jennifer Connelly) and makes a remarkable advancement in the foundations of "game theory," which carries him to the brink of international acclaim. Soon after, John is visited by Agent William Parcher (Ed Harris), from the CIA, who wants to recruit him for code-breaking activities. But evidence suggests that Nash's perceptions of reality are cloudy at best; he is struggling to maintain his tenuous hold on sanity, and Alicia suspects a diagnosis of paranoid schizophrenia. Battling decades of illness with the loyal Alicia by his side, Nash is ultimately able to gain some control over his mental state, and eventually goes on to triumphantly win the Nobel Prize. Based loosely on the book of the same name by Sylvia Nasar, A Beautiful Mind (2001) co-stars Paul Bettany, Adam Goldberg, Anthony Rapp, Christopher Plummer, and Judd Hirsch(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: John Landis directed this rollicking early '60s nostalgia piece reportedly based on screenwriter Chris Miller's real-life experiences as a freshman at prestigious Dartmouth College. Unable to gain acceptance at the snootier fraternities they pledge, Frosh losers Thomas Hulce and Stephen Furst find a home among the Deltas, a motley crew of misfits and sociopaths bent on disrupting the well-starched status quo. Led by seniors (Tim Matheson) and (Peter Riegert), the Delta boys engage in various illegalities that land them in hot water with both the stern college dean (John Vernon) and the neighboring jock fraternity. Their exploits eventually cause them to be placed on "double-secret probation;" finally, they are kicked out of school and, as the dean reminds them, newly eligible for the Vietnam draft. What follows is an anarchic subversion of the annual town parade -- not to mention some genuine hilarity -- as the Deltas raid the festivities for revenge, causing all hell to break loose. While parts of Animal House are uneven, some scenes are side-splittingly funny, particularly the scene in which malcontent literature professor Donald Sutherland smokes pot with his students and discusses some heavy metaphysics. However, the real reason to watch the film is John Belushi as Bluto Blutarsky, the seventh-year senior with a poor memory for world history and a penchant for drinking fifths of Jack Daniels in one draught -- he is spectacular. His memorable performance solidifies his place as one of American cinema's most outrageous comedic performers, in spite of the brevity of his career. In all, Animal House is a highly amusing comedy, sure to bring back memories for anyone who's been to college (even if they never did manage to graduate)(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz, in this hysterical, fast-paced mockumentary(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: In this terrifying horror sequel, husband-and-wife paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren help a single mother living in 1977 London, who claims that she and her children are being terrorized by supernatural forces(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Rand Ravich's sci-fi thriller stars Johnny Depp (soon to be seen as J M Barrie in Neverland) as a Nasa astronaut who loses all contact for two minutes while on a space-walk. Successfully rescued and back on Earth, he gives up his career to join a large corporation, much to the relief of his wife Charlize Theron (The Yards). But, as he starts to act more strangely, she begins to wonder what actually happened in those 120 seconds and what this could mean for their unborn child(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Dean Corso, a book dealer working in New York, is asked to locate the three remaining copies of demonic manuscript - 'The Nine Gates Of The Kingdoms Of Shadows' by a wealthy collector. Before long everyone who comes into contact with the manuscripts ends up dead and his own life is in danger. The hunt soon turns into an obsession and a search for the truth about the manuscript's powers(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realise that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: Mel Gibson stars in this fact-based Vietnam drama as Lt Col Hal Moore, commander of the First Battalion, Seventh Cavalry, assigned to action in the Drang Valley. Soon, he and his men are cornered in a tiny area by more than 2,000 Viet-Cong and engaged in a fight to the death. Randall Wallace's visceral film also stars Greg Kinnear, Barry Pepper and Marc Blucas(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Political drama based on real-life events about a Texas congressman whose intervention in Afghanistan, supplying weapons and other equipment to rebel troops fighting against the Soviet Union, has far-reaching and unforeseen consequences(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: A failed actor takes a job as a high-school drama teacher in Tucson, where he tries to make a comeback by staging an outrageous musical sequel to Shakespeare's play. Steve Coogan stars in this uproarious satire. Directed by Andrew Fleming(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: Following up on her acclaimed debut, Clockwatchers, Jill Sprecher spins this intricate ensemble film about life's big questions. Set in New York City, the film focuses on five different characters with radically different perspectives on life. Gene (Alan Arkin) manages a large insurance company and is a compulsive pessimist, constantly bursting the bubbles of his more cheery colleagues. Walker (John Turturro), who holds a similarly bleak view of the world, decides that he cannot stand another day in his dull life as a physics professor and thus promptly dumps his wife, Patricia (Amy Irving). Troy (Matthew McConaughey) is an up-and-coming lawyer whose career is derailed after a hit-and-run accident. And Beatrice (Clea DuVall) is a modest cleaning woman hoping for a miracle. This film was screened at the 2001 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: The third entry in the Dirty Harry series sees Clint Eastwood saddled with a female assistant (Tyne Daly, later to go on to fame in Cagney and Lacey ) as the pair search for the kidnapped mayor of San Francisco, who's being held hostage by a terrorist group. Tracking them down to a deserted Alcatraz, it's time for Harry to get the trusty Magnum out again in James Fargo's all- action movie(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Espionage comedy starring Eddie Murphy and Owen Wilson. An inexperienced CIA agent (Wilson) is assigned to track down the arms dealers who stole a high-tech US fighter plane that has the technology to become invisible. The only problem is he has to team up with a cocky, and often idiotic, professional boxer, of whom the arms dealers are known to be fans. Also stars Famke Janssen and Malcolm McDowell(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss, Dan Hedaya and Seymour Cassel star in this comedy about mobsters who come out of retirement for one last job. Facing eviction from the hotel where they live, the guys try to scare off the owners with a staged shooting. But the plan backfires, and a hilarious comedy of errors begins. Carrie-Anne Moss, Jennifer Tilly(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: This action drama puts a new spin on Shaft, one of the key "blaxploitation" films of the 1970s. John Shaft (Samuel L. Jackson), the namesake nephew of the legendary private eye (Richard Roundtree), is a street-smart police detective who with his partner Carmen Velez (Vanessa L. Williams) has been assigned to a racially motivated murder case, in which a black college student was killed in front of a restaurant by Walter Williams Jr. (Christian Bale), the sociopathic son of a New York construction tycoon, who then fled the country rather than face prosecution. Diane Palmieri (Toni Collette), a waitress on a smoke break, saw the murder, but she doesn't want to talk to the police. Two years later, Walter is forced to return to New York, but without Diane's testimony, the city doesn't have much of a case. Soon, Shaft, Walter Junior, and Walter Senior's goons are all looking for Diane, with Junior enlisting the help of Peoples Hernandez (Jeffrey Wright), a small-time drug dealer who will do anything to move into the big leagues. Shaft and Carmen find Diane, but discover that she had a good reason for being on the lam for the past two years. Amidst all this activity, John gets frequent advice from his uncle, with whom he ponders the idea of quitting the force and opening a detective agency. Shaft was directed by John Singleton, from a screenplay by Singleton, Richard Price, and Shane Salerno(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Kicked out of a successful metal group 20 years previously, Robert 'Fish' Fishman gets a second chance at fame when he joins his nephew's band. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas and the other Gladers journey across a brutal, obstacle-filled wasteland called the Scorch. Along the way, they search for information regarding the mysterious organisation known as WCKD(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Killer Queen. Jackie is stuck in the lurch when a guest suddenly cancels their appearance on "What's Up, Wisconsin?" She needs to find a replacement, or else lose her job; so she and Fez take the place of the missing guest, pretending to be a couple in love. Christine is so impressed that she takes Jackie out for drinks after work, and spills some personal secrets, then fires Jackie for knowing too much. Donna has her eye on a special someone to ask out for Valentine's Day, but gets turned down. Red introduces Hyde to his secret stash(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Cops on Trial. A&E explores what happens when the protectors become the enemy in American Justice: Cops on Trial. Brought to light by the memorable Rodney King beating, police brutality has become a hot issue. It has even affected working conditions. The Los Angeles police department hardly has enough staff to work the streets due to a drop in enrollment and support. That condition is not surprising given the far-reaching amount of corruption in the system. Ex-police chief Daryl Gates remembers the King incident and the subsequent fall in popularity. Also recalled is the exposure of New York police corruption in all its forms. Frank Serpico investigated the toughest units and found a deep misuse of power. Legal experts explore the best way to prosecute wayward soldiers in this one-hour program(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Newly qualified midwife Jenny Lee prepares to begin her career and is posted to Nonnatus House in London, but what she assumed was a small private hospital turns out to be a nursing convent in the East End. Initially daunted by her new colleagues and surroundings, she slowly finds her feet and is given her first case - the care of a woman pregnant for the 25th time. Jessica Raine, Jenny Agutter, Pam Ferris and Judy Parfitt star in the drama, set in the 1950s and based on the best-selling memoirs of Jennifer Worth.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny sets out to help a heavily pregnant teenage girl who escaped an abusive life in Ireland and made her way to London, only to be taken in by a cafe owner who forced her into prostitution. Meanwhile, new midwife Chummy (Miranda Hart) arrives at Nonnatus House, and despite an overwhelming eagerness to please, she makes slow progress - a problem not helped by her inability to ride a bicycle. Jessica Raine and Amy McAllister co-star in the period medical drama.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is placed on the district nursing roster to improve her experience of community practice, and grows close to an ailing veteran soldier (guest star Roy Hudd). Trixie and Cynthia welcome a new patient to the antenatal clinic, a fortysomething woman who is upset by her pregnancy, despite her husband's joy. But at the birth, everyone gets a surprise. Drama, with Jessica Raine, Laura Main, Bryony Hannah and Miranda Hart.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A baby girl, recently delivered by Jenny, is snatched from her pram, uniting the community in a desperate search for the missing child. A newlywed couple are excited about becoming parents - but when the wife develops a serious medical condition, their chances of happiness are jeopardised. Jessica Raine, Bryony Hannah and Miranda Hart star in the 1950s-set nursing drama, with Thomasin Rand and Tom Goodman-Hill.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny befriends Nonnatus House cleaner Peggy and her brother Frank, who has cancer, and learns all about the siblings' upbringing in the workhouse and the effect it has had on their relationship. Meanwhile, Fred has a new money-making venture - a pig called Evie - but his hopes of bringing home the bacon are scuppered when it turns out the porker is pregnant, so the midwives rally round to deliver the piglets.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Monica Joan develops pneumonia after being found mysteriously wandering near the docks - but things only gets worse when she is accused of theft and faces the prospect of prison. Chummy's mother arrives to meet PC Noakes, but when the visit is less than a success, the midwife suffers a crisis of confidence and breaks off her relationship - leaving Jenny and the others trying to persuade her she is making a terrible mistake. Judy Parfitt, Miranda Hart and Jessica Raine star.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns find a newborn baby on the steps of the convent. The discovery prompts the community to rally round, providing food and clothing for the unexpected arrival. But the question remains - who is his mother and why did she leave him there? While the investigation gets under way, Jenny gets caught up in the mystery surrounding semi-vagrant local Mrs Jenkins, and the newly married Chummy pulls out all the stops to mount a successful children's nativity play. Jessica Raine, Miranda Hart, Pam Ferris and Jenny Agutter star.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.(n)

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Disaster strikes when Mike's favourite country musician Holly Collins is found electrocuted in what appears to be a drunken accident or possibly suicide. However, Mike finds a note scrawled in lipstick and begins to investigate the dysfunctional band members - Slim Fingers, Waylon Strings and Jesse James. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad is ordered by its new boss to look into the unsolved murder of a barrister found bound and gagged in his car 25 years ago. The case was a rare failure for a former chief inspector, although his notes point to a very clear suspect. As they uncover the late advocate's unusual hobbies, they gradually learn exactly what happened. Anita Dobson, Jenny Agutter and Keith Barron guest star.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies stars in a feature-length episode of the offbeat crime drama. Master of illusion Jonathan is called upon to solve several disappearances inside the gloomy attic of a vast Gothic house, but is completely baffled by the mystery, which for 70 years has been attributed to the ghost of a madman said to prey upon human flesh. When two women shelter from a thunderstorm there one night, the ominous presence claims another victim, leaving her friend - Joey Ross - determined to get to the truth of what happened. Jonathan finds himself working alongside Joey, and it seems his formidable powers of deduction are in danger of being eclipsed by her raw intuition. With Sheridan Smith as Joey.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Trek: Spy on the Wildebeest
programme.desc: Conclusion. The migration reaches Kenya's Masai Mara, where the river presents the strongest challenge yet for the calves. Cameras reveal how crocodiles and hippos are preying on stragglers, while the rough waters threaten to sweep the animals away.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: A look at sinkholes and the dangers they pose to people, animals and property.(n)

programme.title: The Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: The second of two programme focuses on man-made treasures. Dallas Campbell dives to a shipwreck where 5,000 emeralds have been found, hunts for a treasure chest hidden in the Rocky Mountains and comes face to face with China's Terracotta Army. Ellie Harrison enters a jewelled room in Russia decorated with millions of pounds' worth of amber, meets diamond-cutters who know a single slip of the hand could be costly and travels to Egypt, where she stares at Tutankhamun's death mask, one of the most famous golden images on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Meerkats: Secrets of an Animal Superstar.
programme.desc: Meerkat pups Squirt and Weeny belong to one of the most famous animal families on the planet and are also part of a 20-year animal behaviour study. David Attenborough narrates the full story of the research, from the early days when it was a challenge to even get close to a meerkat to the latest revelations about these animals and their complex lives.(n)

programme.title: Trek: Spy on the Wildebeest
programme.desc: Conclusion. The migration reaches Kenya's Masai Mara, where the river presents the strongest challenge yet for the calves. Cameras reveal how crocodiles and hippos are preying on stragglers, while the rough waters threaten to sweep the animals away.(n)

programme.title: Life on Earth: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: The natural history series' focuses on another fossil found in China, this time allowing researchers to trace the evolution of mammals back another 35 million years.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age Giants
programme.desc: Alice Roberts sets out to discover why the creatures that dominated the planet 40,000 years ago died out as the world started to warm up and the end of the Ice Age neared. She examines how the woolly rhino was unable to adapt when the increase in snowfall prevented it eating enough grass, and learns that mastodons turned on one another.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Series exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The programme also examines mankind's dependence on the elements, and how animals' lives are governed by the seasons, as a polar bear prepares its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at the animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough concludes the documentary series by focusing on the world's deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Ngogo forest in Uganda, to study the largest chimpanzee group in the world defending their territory. The parasitic fungi cordyceps and creatures including the flying colugo, red crab spiders and blue birds of paradise are also observed by the naturalist in jungles around the world.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses `fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Series exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The programme also examines mankind's dependence on the elements, and how animals' lives are governed by the seasons, as a polar bear prepares its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at the animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre Part 2
programme.desc: Leatherface and his buzz saw are back and on the rampage once more(n)

programme.title: The Rewrite
programme.desc: A has-been screenwriter reluctantly takes a teaching job at a university in Upstate New York. He soon becomes emotionally invested in the lives of his students, particularly a single mother who recently caught the writing bug(n)

programme.title: Class
programme.desc: Rites-of-passage romantic comedy. When term begins at the exclusive Vernon Academy, shy Jonathan Ogner finds himself sharing a room with the wealthy and outgoing Squire Ellsworth Burroughs IV. Jonathan is naive and inexperienced but soon becomes embroiled in an affair with an older woman, unaware that she is the mother of his new roommate(n)

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia
programme.desc: Jess Aarons trained all summer to become the fastest runner in school, so he's very upset when newcomer Leslie Burke outruns him and everyone else. Despite this and other differences, including that she's rich, he's poor, and she's a city girl, he's a country boy, the two become fast friends. Together, they create Terabithia, a land of monsters, trolls, ogres, and giants and rule as king and queen. This friendship helps Jess cope with the tragedy that makes him realise what Leslie taught him(n)

programme.title: The Rewrite
programme.desc: A has-been screenwriter reluctantly takes a teaching job at a university in Upstate New York. He soon becomes emotionally invested in the lives of his students, particularly a single mother who recently caught the writing bug(n)

programme.title: The Good Son
programme.desc: Melodrama about a 12-year-old (Macaulay Culkin) whose evil antics are witnessed only by his cousin (Elijah Wood). Susan: Wendy Crewson. Jack: David Morse. Wallace: Daniel Hugh Kelly. Connie: Quinn Culkin. Alice: Jacqueline Brooks. Directed by Joseph Ruben(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: In this unconventional yet heartwarming comedy-drama, an aging rocker returns home to her estranged family after years on the road following her dreams, and must face the music as she tries to make things right with her loved ones(n)

programme.title: Cadillac Records
programme.desc: In 1940s Chicago, Polish immigrant Leonard Chess sets up a record label, bringing a string of talented black artists into the mainstream. With acts such as Chuck Berry and Etta James on his books, the money begins to roll in, but as their success grows, trouble brews behind the scenes. Biopic(n)

programme.title: For Love of the Game
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Michael Shaara, For Love of the Game brought Kevin Costner back to the world of baseball after his successes with Bull Durham (1988) and Field of Dreams (1989). Billy Chapel (Kevin Costner) is a star pitcher with the Detroit Tigers, standing on the mound at Yankee Stadium and throwing what is shaping up to be a perfect game with the help of his best friend and catcher, Gus Osinski (John C. Reilly). However, Billy is having a hard time keeping his mind on the game; he's come to a crossroads in both his personal and professional lives, and he isn't sure what to do or where to go. He's learned that the Tigers are about to be sold, and the new owners intend to trade him at the end of the season, and that his girlfriend Jane (Kelly Preston) is planning to leave him. For Love of the Game represents a change of pace for director Sam Raimi, best-known for the Evil Dead trilogy and the acclaimed suspense drama A Simple Plan (1998) (although Raimi, a baseball fan born in Michigan, doubtless enjoyed making a film featuring the Detroit Tigers)(n)

programme.title: Nine Months
programme.desc: Hugh Grant stars as a reluctant dad-to-be, with Julianne Moore as his long-suffering girlfriend and the late Robin Williams as a nervous obstetrician(n)

programme.title: The White Queen
programme.desc: The Princess in the Tower. The future of the princes in the Tower is in Richard's hands: they are a threat to his reign but also to Margaret's hopes of seeing her son Henry Tudor on the throne. As Margaret plots the boys' removal, Anne is tormented by fears she has unwittingly sealed the princes' fate. Elizabeth, in sanctuary, is horrified to realise she has made a pact with her enemies and turns to witchcraft to punish the guilty(n)

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: A group of misfits enter a Las Vegas dodgeball tournament in order to save their cherished local gym from the onslaught of a corporate health fitness chain(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: One man wants free cable while his strangely possessive cable guy wants a new friend(n)

programme.title: White Noise 2: The Light
programme.desc: A near-death experience leaves grieving dad Abe with the ability to save marked souls from the Grim Reaper. But crossing death has its consequences(n)

programme.desc: A has-been screenwriter reluctantly takes a teaching job at a university in Upstate New York. He soon becomes emotionally invested in the lives of his students, particularly a single mother who recently caught the writing bug(n)

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Jonathan Kaplan's all-action western sees women take the lead, as Madeline Stowe, Mary Stuart Masterson, Drew Barrymore and Andie McDowell take on the gun-slinging guys. The four heroines are prostitutes in the one-horse town of Echo City, but when Cody Zamora is condemned to hang for killing an over-zealous customer, the three others spring her from jail and head for Texas, where she has a bulging bank account she'll split with the others. Along the way they meet up with outlaws, including the Jarrett Brothers, but can they avoid both the clutches of the law and the amorous attentions of their admirers (not to mention matching their gunplay) to make it to freedom?(n)

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace
programme.desc: A LAPD officer will stop at nothing to force out the interracial couple who just moved in next door. A young couple has just moved into their California dream home when they become the target of their next-door neighbour, who disapproves of their relationship. A stern, single father, this tightly wound LAPD officer has appointed himself the watchdog of the neighbourhood. His nightly foot patrols and overly watchful eyes bring comfort to some, but he becomes increasingly aggressive to the newlyweds. These persistent intrusions into their lives cause the couple to fight back(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: As American soldiers go to war in 1943, Tom Hanks is hired to coach a team of female baseball players, including Geena Davis and Madonna. Can they win over a sceptical public?(n)

programme.title: Bad Girls

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: In this adventure-filled sequel to the 2004 blockbuster 'National Treasure', Nicolas Cage reprises his role as artifact hunter and archaeologist Benjamin Franklin Gates. During a lecture about John Wilkes Booth (Abraham Lincoln¿s murderer) and Thomas Gates (Ben¿s great-grandfather), another treasure hunter by the name of Mitch Wilkinson stands up and presents a missing page of Booth¿s diary -- where Thomas is mentioned as a co-conspirator in Lincoln¿s assassination. Outraged, Ben decides to prove the honor of his ancestor, and together with his wife, Abigail, and his best friend, the writer Riley Poole, heads to France, England and Washington to collect clues(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: In Plane Sight. The Team employs a new method to prepare B.A. for a flight to South America, where drug smugglers are responsible for the imprisonment of an innocent pilot. Judy: Judy Strangis. Corliss: Anthony Charnota. Face: Dirk Benedict(n)

programme.title: Highlander: The Final Dimension
programme.desc: The third episode in the Highlander saga, this film describes the ongoing contest between immortals that began in Scotland 400 years ago. When the evil Kane breaks out of his tomb, he begins a bloody, super-powered search for good warrior Connor(n)

programme.title: Rocky V
programme.desc: A brain-damaged and broke Rocky returns to his old working-class neighborhood in Philadelphia, where he shows a promising young boxer the ropes(n)

programme.title: Dolph Lundgren Is the Killing Machine
programme.desc: Family man Edward Genn is desperate to escape his secret past as an assassin, but when his cover is blown, old enemies re-emerge(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: Sequel to the 1976 Oscar-winning favourite which catapulted Sylvester Stallone to megastardom. Things are looking grim for Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa. His wife is in a post-natal coma and he has an eye injury that could cost him his sight. But heavyweight champion Apollo Creed's pride is still smarting from their first bout, and he wants a rematch with the Italian Stallion(n)

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: Frank takes a job driving the young son of Miami's anti-drugs tsar. Florida was supposed to be a holiday, but when Colombian killers kidnap the boy and frame Frank, he has to start taking life seriously one more. Martial arts action(n)

programme.title: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai
programme.desc: Acclaimed filmmaker Jim Jarmusch wrote and directed this offbeat blend of drama, mysticism and comedy. Forest Whitaker stars as a Zen-like hit man who lives by the ancient code of the Samurai. But he's forced to defend himself when he's betrayed by the eccentric crime family he works for. John Tormey, Henry Silva(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Inspired stoner comedy stars Seth Rogen as a pothead named Dale who witnesses a drug-related hit and goes on the lam with his spacey dealer, Saul (James Franco). Rogen co-wrote the screenplay with Evan Goldberg. Directed by David Gordon Green. The film's title comes from the name of a wildly potent strain of marijuana, "the dopest dope I ever smoked," according to Saul. Rosie Perez costars as a dirty cop, and Gary Cole plays a nasty drug lord(n)

Vallon dies and his young son Amsterdam disappears, only to return a man (Leonardo DiCaprio) torn between a thirst for revenge and a fascination for the charismatic Cutting, with Cameron Diaz as Jenny Everdeane, the pickpocket they both love. programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A teenager becomes the prime suspect in the murder of his family, and Brenda tries to resist the imposition of budget cuts at LAPD. Detective drama starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames investigate when the owner of one of the city's most exclusive hotels is found dead from a fatal injection of Botox, and suspicion falls on her unstable daughter, who resented her mother's interference in her love life. Crime drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigate when a mysterious, fast-spreading illness strikes children from military families. While Gibbs investigates the cause, Abby and Jimmy partner with the Naval Medical Research Centre in the hope of delivering a cure before the holidays. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed by a stolen surveillance drone and the team links it to elusive terrorist Benham Parsa. NCIS joins forces with the Department of Defence to track down the device before it is used for a large-scale attack, but Gibbs is less than pleased that he has to work with his ex-lover Hollis Mann. Meanwhile, McGee hopes he will be granted time off to attend a black-tie gala honouring his girlfriend Delilah. Guest starring Susanna Thompson (Arrow).(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Flynn and Provenza attend the funeral of a former police colleague, but events take a surprising turn when the contents of the coffin are revealed. Meanwhile, Brenda and Fritz's house-hunting gains momentum. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and the team face a race against time to find a missing eight-year-old girl who disappeared on her way home from school, and Gabriel puts his career in jeopardy when he takes drastic action to solve the case.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A psychiatrist is found murdered, leading Goren and Eames to suspect an ophthalmologist may be involved, especially when they realise that his research into schizophrenia could be masking mental health problems of his own. programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames investigate the seemingly random murders of several homeless people, uncovering a fraud involving a crooked insurance agent. Crime drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan, with Lance Reddick (The Wire).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In an effort to find the terrorist Parsa, Gibbs and the NCIS team track down one of his cohorts using evidence gleaned from the drone attack which has killed six people and wounded a further 22. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a port authority officer reveals Parsa's possible whereabouts as the team continues the hunt for the terrorist intent on wiping out NCIS. programme.desc: Mayor West marries Lois's sister and the pair move into the Griffin family home, where he becomes Peter's best friend. However, not everyone welcomes the new arrivals, and Stewie takes over Chris's room after being evicted from his own.(n)

Mabel Buchman (Janeane Garafolo), grown-up daughter of Paul and Jamie Buchman (Paul Reiser, Helen Hunt), follows in her dad's footsteps by producing a documentary film about her family. The starting point is the startling revelation that, thanks to a genealogical snafu, Paul and Jamie were never really married. Originally telecast as an hour-long special, this episode has since been divided into two half hours for syndication(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Dumbbell Indemnity. Broke from courting his new girlfriend, Moe recruits Homer for an illegal scheme so he can keep financing the romancing. Voices include Helen Hunt, Hank Azaria, Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Harry Shearer and Nancy Cartwright(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa Gets an A. Springfield Elementary earns a grant, thanks to Lisa's latest A---a grade acquired by cheating; Homer plans to fatten up a small lobster, but becomes emotionally attached(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Mansion Family. While house-sitting for Burns (who's getting a checkup at the Mayo Clinic), Homer throws a party aboard the billionaire's yacht in international waters---where anything goes. Britney Spears is a guest voice. Voices: Harry Shearer, Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Pamela Hayden, Yeardley Smith, Nancy Cartwright(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Elementary School Musical. While Homer and Bart escort Krusty to Oslo to collect a Nobel Prize, Lisa attends Expressions, a performing arts camp. There she meets Sarah, Flynn and Aiesha who welcome Lisa to the camp with a song, before she meets two counsellors Ethan and Kurt who sing and play guitar. At the end of the week Lisa has fallen in love with the theatre and music and has big ambitions(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Them, Robot. Mr. Burns replaces all of his employees with robots—with one exception: Homer. This raises the unemployment rate in Springfield significantly, and leads to much misery. And it hits home to Homer, too, when robots attack him(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Saga of Carl. Friendships are tested when Carl skips town with $200,000, winnings from a lottery ticket he bought with Homer, Moe and Lenny(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Yellow Badge of Cowardge. In the Season 25 finale, Bart's victory in Springfield Elementary's annual "Race Around the School" leaves him guilt-ridden because he received outside help in achieving his win. Meanwhile, Homer is fired up about getting the Fourth of July fireworks reinstated after they were canceled for budgetary reasons(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Kids Are All Fight. Homer has an old roll of film developed and it exposes memories of how Lisa and Bart first started fighting with each other(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa the Veterinarian. Lisa wants to be a veterinarian after she performs CPR on a raccoon, but learns a tough lesson when the neglected class hamster dies. Elsewhere, Marge moonlights as a crime scene cleaner to make extra money, but the gory scenes impact her too much(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Little Girl in the Big Ten
programme.desc: Little Girl in the Big Ten. Lisa pretends to be a student so that she can hang out with some college girls she's met. Meanwhile, Bart has to live in a bubble after being bitten by a mosquito that is carrying a contagious illness(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Barting Over. Jane Kaczmarek, skateboarder Tony Hawk and Blink 182 are guest voices in the 300th episode as Bart divorces his parents after learning that Homer put him in an embarrassing commercial as a baby and then spent all the residuals(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: The Double Deuce. A report that another member of his old squadron has died under suspicious circumstances leads Woodhouse to fear for his life(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Tragical History. After being told by his ISIS colleagues that he's a failure once too often, Cyril injects a virus into the agency's mainframe in order to detect it and be seen as a hero. Not surprisingly, things don't go as planned(n)

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: An ordinary teenager is recruited by a mystical martial arts master for a vitally important quest. He must find seven magical spheres before they fall into the hands of an evil warlord, who intends to use their power to let him take over the world. Fantasy adventure based on the Japanese cartoon series, starring Justin Chatwin, Chow Yun-Fat and James Marsters.(n)

programme.title: A Monster in Paris
programme.desc: A would-be inventor accidentally creates a monster which escapes onto the streets of Paris. As the scientist and his sidekick try to find their creation before the police do, the creature befriends a kindly cabaret singer, who discovers he has a gentle nature and a gift for music. Animated comedy, with the voices of Vanessa Paradis and Sean Lennon.(n)

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin.(n)

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: The manager of an apartment complex asks a Wall Street financier to manage pension funds for him and his friends, but the man pockets all the money instead. When he realises the fraudster is going to get away with the crime and the money will never be found, he enlists the help of a professional thief to steal it back. Crime comedy, with Ben Stiller, Eddie Murphy, Alan Alda, Tea Leoni, Casey Affleck and Matthew Broderick.(n)

programme.title: The Cold Light of Day
programme.desc: A man on a sailing holiday in Spain discovers his family have been abducted. His search for them leads him to learn that his father has been leading a double-life as a CIA agent, and has stolen top-secret information - which the kidnappers will stop at nothing to obtain. Thriller, starring Henry Cavill, Bruce Willis and Sigourney Weaver.(n)

programme.title: Goon
programme.desc: An underachieving bouncer is the black sheep of a family of doctors, until he beats an ice hockey player in a fight, and is recruited by the team. While he has little sporting prowess, his ability to beat up opposing players leads him to a successful career - and a showdown with his equally violent hero. Comedy, starring Seann William Scott, Jay Baruchel and Liev Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: Bronson
programme.desc: Biopic of convict Charles Bronson, who was sent to prison for seven years after a failed armed robbery, only for his sentence to be increased to more than 30 years due to an escalating series of incidents, ultimately earning him tabloid celebrity as the most violent prisoner in Britain. Starring Tom Hardy, Hugh Ross and Juliet Oldfield.(n)

programme.title: Red State
programme.desc: Three teenagers are lured to a remote area by an online offer of sex, only to fall into the clutches of a fanatical Christian sect. The preacher leading the group is on a mission to kill all those he judges as sinners, but his actions have been noticed by the local sheriff, and the church is soon under siege by federal agents. Thriller, starring Michael Parks and John Goodman.(n)

programme.title: The Muppet Movie
programme.desc: Kermit the frog is persuaded by his agent that he has a future in movies. He sets off on a journey across America to realise his dream, gathering a crowd of like-minded friends along the way - but the owner of a French restaurant plans to make him the dish of the day. Comedy, starring Dom DeLuise and Charles Durning alongside the puppet characters, with cameos from Mel Brooks, Orson Welles and Steve Martin.(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: Reporters Kermit the Frog and Fozzie Bear are sacked for missing out on a massive scoop about the theft of jewellery from famous British fashion designer Lady Holiday. To try to re-establish their reputations, the duo and Gonzo fly to London to see if they can track down the culprit. Comedy, with the voices of Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with cameo appearances by John Cleese, Diana Rigg, Charles Grodin and Peter Ustinov.(n)

programme.title: The Muppet Christmas Carol
programme.desc: An embittered Victorian miser hates the festive season and people in general, but on Christmas Eve, the ghosts of his former business partners, the Marley brothers, visit him in the night. They warn him three spirits are coming to make him change his ways by showing him visions of the past, the present and what the future may hold. Comedy, with Michael Caine and Steven Mackintosh alongside the puppet characters.(n)

programme.title: Muppet Treasure Island
programme.desc: A youngster finds a treasure map and joins an expedition searching for a famous buccaneer's lost treasure on an unexplored island. However, their mission falls foul of a band of pirates hiding out among the crew. Musical comedy based on Robert Louis Stevenson's novel, starring Tim Curry, Billy Connolly, Jennifer Saunders and Kevin Bishop alongside the puppet characters.(n)

programme.title: The Jewel of the Nile
programme.desc: A novelist travels to the Middle East to become a sheik's official biographer, only to end up being held hostage by him. Her lover joins forces with an old enemy to rescue her, but they get drawn into the hunt for a mysterious ancient treasure that has a connection to an eccentric holy man. Comedy adventure sequel to Romancing the Stone, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours
programme.desc: A couple living in suburbia and adjusting to new parenthood are determined to prove they can still be cool when a household of students moves in next door. However, when their raucous neighbours' wild parties disrupt their lives, they decide to fight back, leading to a vicious cycle of one-upmanship. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Zac Efron and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: High-Rise
programme.desc: A doctor secures himself a new home in a luxurious apartment complex, where residents are able to shut out the rest of the world. As society begins to break down in the face of failing infrastructure, tension erupts between residents of different floors, leading to a literal class war. Ben Wheatley's satirical thriller based on JG Ballard's novel, starring Tom Hiddleston, Jeremy Irons, Sienna Miller and Luke Evans.(n)

programme.desc: Ree Drummond's cooks hearty breakfast biscuits that her husband and son are coming to collect on their way to feed the cattle.(n)

programme.desc: Ree Drummond is sharing four vibrant recipes to celebrate the colours of summer.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's daughter Paige and her friend Stanton request Chinese food for their sleepover dinner, so Ree prepares an Asian-inspired feast.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her friend Hyacinth are throwing a graduation party for their daughters, and it is going to be the perfect send-off for the graduates.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers come up with a fat-friendly pie for fellow dieter Ann, baking a pastry treat that comes in below the 700 calories of a standard pork pie - but keen to lose as much weight as they can, they don't taste it themselves. Moving on to Dave's home town of Barrow-in-Furness in Cumbria, the duo try to persuade the diners in Chinese and Indian restaurants that their favourite dishes can be even better with all the fattening elements removed.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Chef Judy Joo introduces some of the most traditional, classic Korean dishes of bibimpap, tofu and bossam. Back in her kitchen, she puts her own twist on these family classics.(n)

programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo introduces us to her family for birthday celebrations, lunchbox designing and Kimchi making - because good Korean food is all about family and sharing.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares his recipe for beef stroganoff accompanied by fluffy rice, and a red onion and parsley pickle. He also makes Moroccan-style mussels with tapenade toasties and cucumber salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares more quick meals, including fish baps, mushy peas and tartare sauce, plus mushroom farfalle with blue cheese and a hazelnut and apple salad.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Easter on the ranch starts with a Good Friday delivery of hot cross buns to friends. Ree makes tortellini primavera and 'krispy' eggs, with a basket of crudites and a spinach dip.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummonds celebrate the completion of their new office with a shrimp cocktail bar with three sauces, plus spicy Italian meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and sweet brownie pops.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo explores the healthy fast food in Seoul on offer to commuters, from smartphone shopping to frozen yoghurt. Back home, she serves up a ramyun noodle dish.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo introduces Korea's famous barbecue dishes with the help of K-pop band, UKiss, and her parents. At home, she makes Korean-American style barbecue chicken.(n)

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: The final three bakers create snacks for a groom's welcome basket, before creating wedding cakes inspired by Mexico, Hawaii and Italy.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create low-calorie versions of their favourite party treats, including fairy cakes, quiche and chilli tacos, and Olly Smith offers advice on wines suitable for slimmers. The duo then reflect on how trying to lose weight has improved their lives and learn whether the Big Dieters have also managed to change their eating habits - before paying a final visit to diabetes expert Roy Taylor and dietician Ashley Adamson to discover if their new diets have yielded the desired results.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Chicken Dim Sum and Crab Bricks.
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is in the kitchen and he prepares chicken dim sum with coconut buns, cucumber pickle and hoi sin sauce, plus `crackin' crab briks', couscous salad and salsa.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to cook crispy duck and hoisin lettuce parcels, before preparing chicken cacciatore, spaghetti and smoky tomato sauce.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a husband and wife in Nashville who run a gourmet food truck serving unique versions of the grilled cheese sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a chef in Kansas City who serves a dressed-up version of comfort food, with dishes including chicken pot pie and steamed mussels.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to New York's Brick Lane Curry House to try what is promoted as the hottest curry in America.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman takes on a plate of 15 dozen oysters at New Orleans' Acme Oyster House.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel is called into help a Port Washington grill, where tough economic times have prompted the owners to change from their traditional Italian fare to an American menu.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Marko and Brett own competing food trucks in San Diego, but have put aside their differences to investigate revenue loss in both of their vehicles.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After already successfully battling one fast food chain over the rights to his signature sandwich, the owner of Devine Pastabilities now fears someone from within is trying to steal his creation.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: A visit to Miami where a law student changed careers to prepare comfort food such as spicy oxtail and ragu.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a sibling-run Vietnamese restaurant in Holladay, Utah where they are serving up honey glazed pork vermicelli noodle buns.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine visits Fort Bragg, the largest US army installation in the world, where he rejuvenates one of the only full-service restaurants on the post, the Green Beret Club.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After losing thousands of dollars in unaccounted alcohol, the owner of Big Earl's Greasy Eats in Cave Creek investigates rumours of unauthorised late-night staff parties.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: While investigating a Phoenix eatery, the Mystery Diners encounter several problem employees who threaten patrons, drink on the job and eat customers' food.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels around Europe and north Africa to experience local cultures through their cuisine, beginning in Marrakech, where he tries street food, visits a communal bread oven, makes a nomad stew and joins a family for lunch to sample Moroccan home cooking.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver seeks the authentic tastes of Spain in Andalucia. He makes paella for the whole town of Ronda, birthplace of modern bullfighting, and is taught how to cut serrano ham by an award-winning father and son team. As he joins in the local festivities, including carrying a giant statue of the Virgin Mary from church to church, he takes time to cook tomato salad with chorizo, pork chops with Spanish beans, and quail's egg with black pudding.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Swedish capital, where he tries reindeer heart at an old indoor market and catches a boat to pick wild mushrooms and blueberries on one of the city's surrounding islands. He also tries fermented herring, heads to the royal palace to check the guards' menu, and prepares gravadlax, blueberry buns, creamy mushrooms, pike perch and roasted beetroot salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver steers away from the tourist trails in Venice as he explores the gastronomy of the Italian city. He prepares spaghetti vongole for a group of local fishermen, is taught the art of the perfect risotto by Ruggero Bovo, samples prosecco and cooks a bellini with beef carpaccio. The chef also tries his hand at minestrone with vegetables before being joined by old friend Gennaro Contaldo to make a Venetian tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Greek capital, where he heads to the street markets for his take on the local fast food - souvlaki and kebabs. The chef then learns how honey is made, teams up with a cheese-making priest and milks a goat, and prepares a selection of recipes including fisherman's stew, Greek salad, pistachio and honey cake, and a tuna dish.(n)

The chef then learns how honey is made, teams up with a cheese-making priest and milks a goat, and prepares a selection of recipes including fisherman's stew, Greek salad, pistachio and honey cake, and a tuna dish.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels around Europe and north Africa to experience local cultures through their cuisine, beginning in Marrakech, where he tries street food, visits a communal bread oven, makes a nomad stew and joins a family for lunch to sample Moroccan home cooking.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver seeks the authentic tastes of Spain in Andalucia. He makes paella for the whole town of Ronda, birthplace of modern bullfighting, and is taught how to cut serrano ham by an award-winning father and son team. As he joins in the local festivities, including carrying a giant statue of the Virgin Mary from church to church, he takes time to cook tomato salad with chorizo, pork chops with Spanish beans, and quail's egg with black pudding.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Swedish capital, where he tries reindeer heart at an old indoor market and catches a boat to pick wild mushrooms and blueberries on one of the city's surrounding islands. He also tries fermented herring, heads to the royal palace to check the guards' menu, and prepares gravadlax, blueberry buns, creamy mushrooms, pike perch and roasted beetroot salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver steers away from the tourist trails in Venice as he explores the gastronomy of the Italian city. He prepares spaghetti vongole for a group of local fishermen, is taught the art of the perfect risotto by Ruggero Bovo, samples prosecco and cooks a bellini with beef carpaccio. The chef also tries his hand at minestrone with vegetables before being joined by old friend Gennaro Contaldo to make a Venetian tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Greek capital, where he heads to the street markets for his take on the local fast food - souvlaki and kebabs. The chef then learns how honey is made, teams up with a cheese-making priest and milks a goat, and prepares a selection of recipes including fisherman's stew, Greek salad, pistachio and honey cake, and a tuna dish.(n)

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie decides his staff need to work harder and vows to sack the next employee he catches slacking. Mrs Cakeworthy is the first out the door, but she soon has her boss regretting his decision when he learns she is a witch. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Ella Kenion star.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Ben becomes convinced the stresses of family life will bring on a heart attack, despite reassurances from his doctor. Geoffrey Palmer and Wendy Craig star.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: When Tim's boss visits he feels sure that promotion is on the cards, but talk focuses on his early retirement.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy's evasive remarks suggest Judith's new romance has problems, which Jean is only too keen to help solve - with disastrous results. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads
programme.desc: Thelma looks on with disapproval as Terry helps Bob move his most treasured possessions to his new house, releasing a flood of nostalgic memories about their youthful misadventures. Comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and Compo get into another scrape after Howard asks them to deliver an unusual gift to Marina - a cast iron bath.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and an enthusiastic Compo plot to save Smiler from the terrible fate of being Nora Batty's ex-lodger.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy comes up with the crazy idea of safety underwear after he collides with Compo while riding his old bicycle. Meanwhile, Howard tries several futile methods of increasing his height after concluding Pearl is attracted to taller men.(n)

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads begin work on dismantling the historic Transporter Bridge, but tension between the Serbian and Kosovan workers soon starts slowing things down - and worries about Bomber's health add to their woes. Elsewhere, Mickey Startup dispatches hitman Teddy Platt to teach Moxey the error of his ways, while Oz has an eye-opening reunion with son Rod. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's popular comic drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.(n)
